column4: In-house counsel on the move: Broadmark REIT taps new GC as pandemic roils industry
column5: Broadmark Realty Capital Inc, a real estate investment trust (REIT), has appointed former Ventas Inc attorney Nevin Boparai as its chief legal officer as the coronavirus pandemic shakes up the market for commercial space.
column6: Boparai most recently served as assistant general counsel at Ventas, a healthcare REIT, and before that as counsel of corporate transactions for Abbott Laboratories. He was also an associate at Jones Day in Silicon Valley.
column7: To read the full story on Westlaw Today, click here: bit.ly/32urXHS

column4: Ventas sees slowdown in move-ins to senior centers amid coronavirus pandemic
column5: (Reuters) - Ventas Inc VTR.N said on Tuesday it was experiencing a slowdown in move-ins at its senior housing business and withdrew its 2020 financial forecasts, as the coronavirus pandemic raises the risk of tenants moving out.
column6: The real estate investment trust, which also runs long-term care facilities, said it expected the trends it was seeing to only accelerate, leading to its decision to withdraw its forecast.
column7: The tally of coronavirus cases in the United States has multiplied quickly and has surpassed 4,600 infections and at least 83 deaths.
column8: Elderly care facilities are especially vulnerable to the virus, as evidenced by multiple deaths related to coronavirus tied to a elderly nursing home in King County, Washington.
column9: The home in King County is not connected with Ventas.
column10: Ventas, which operates over 700 senior housing properties in the United States, said its senior housing partners and tenants were implementing best practices to respond to the outbreak.

column4: Ventas sees slowdown in move-ins to senior housing facilities amid coronavirus pandemic
column5: March 17 (Reuters) - Ventas Inc said on Tuesday it was experiencing a slowdown in move-ins at its senior housing business and that the coronavirus pandemic raises the risk of tenants moving out as it withdrew its 2020 financial forecasts.
column6: The tally of coronavirus cases in the United States has multiplied quickly and has surpassed 4,600 infections and at least 83 deaths.
column7: Elderly care facilities are especially vulnerable to the virus, as evidenced by deaths related to coronavirus reported on Sunday tied to a elderly nursing home in King County, Washington.
column8: The home in King County is not connected with Ventas. (Reporting by Manas Mishra in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)

column4: IN BRIEF: Ventas nabs Assurant's top lawyer as general counsel
column5: Ventas Inc, a U.S. healthcare real-estate investment trust, has swiped Assurant Inc’s legal chief Carey Roberts to serve as its general counsel.
column6: Roberts will join Chicago-based Ventas sometime in the first quarter of 2020, the company said in a statement on Tuesday. She will report to Ventas’ chief executive officer Debra Cafaro, the statement said.
column7: To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2T2zYPT
